page.intro: Participants should read these articles when they start this course. They will provide background knowledge and a common vocabulary about self-regulated learning.
page.content:
Participants should read these articles when they start this course. They will provide background knowledge and a common vocabulary about self-regulated learning.

Across the Content Areas

  • The TEAL Center Fact Sheet on Self-regulated Learning makes explicit how self-regulated learning can be applied to the adult education context.

  • The TEAL Center Fact Sheet on Metacognitive Processes shares ideas for boosting learners' thinking about the processes they use to learn.
    Bookmark these Fact Sheets for future reference and share with colleagues. They may also be downloaded from the TEAL Web Site.
  • This article defines and describes self-regulated learning and why it's important to help students develop self-regulation strategies, and then it turns the concept around to show how teachers can use self-regulation strategies for their own professional growth.
